title: Your Halloween Soundtrack, From A Candy Frenzy To The Dance Of Death
teaser: Music writer Colin Fleming exhumes some new Halloween music essentials.
contentencoded:
'Tis the season for some holiday music. Don't worry, we're not cueing up Christmas carols quite yet â€” but Halloween is approaching and it got us to thinking about the soundtrack to this particular holiday. Sure, there's Michael Jackson's "Thriller," with that eerie Vincent Price voice-over, and if you want something kitschy, you've got the "Monster Mash." But after that, you're left in a musical abyss.

Music writer Colin Fleming joins NPR's Rachel Martin to introduce some Halloween music you might not have thought of, including a jazz clarinet piece that's truly scary and an R&B groove to get a mummy dancing. Hear their conversation at the audio link, and check out the music and Fleming's commentary below.
